intro: Haplocarpha lessingii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has narrow, silvery-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep roots and waxy foliage to reduce water loss. Haplocarpha lessingii is often found in sandy soils and is an important part of the desert ecosystem.
